page.title: 18SHARDLOW HALL
page.content: Shardlow Hall is used by the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food. At Shardlow Hall there are several different departments. These include, Soil Samples of England and Wales, Entomology and Horticulture. There is also a plant clinic at the Hall. As well as office and laboratory work, those employed sometimes go to conferences or to give talks. They also visit farmers to give advice. At Shardlow Hall there is a social club for the employees. Local legend says that the Hall is haunted by a Lady in Grey who has been seen by the lake. The Lady in Green appears when the roof is disturbed.
